captions.text:
In the battle of the sexes we are 
fiercely divided, who has a worse when it
comes to pain?

On the one hand women are left with the
task of fitting a watermelon sized

object through a coin sized hole.  On the
other hand, males protest that even the

slightest nick of their family jewels
can leave them incapacitated.
So which hurts more, childbirth or getting kicked in the balls?

Before we begin there is a rumor that is
circulating the internet claiming that

the human body can take up to 45
del units of pain and yet a mother feels

up to 57 del of pain during
childbirth,

which is apparently equivalent to 20
bones being fractured at once.

The claim then goes on to suggest that
being kicked in the balls brings more

than 9000 del of pain.  Now
apart from the absurd logic that both of

these events can surpass the alleged
human limit it, actually uses a unit of

pain, the del, which doesn't even exist.
There is a unit of pain once devised

called the dol, from the latin word for
pain "dolor" but we will discuss this later.

To really evaluate this question we
first need to understand what pain is,
which isn't an easy task.

There is actually a group of specialized
nerve cells in your body called nociceptors
that react to pain.

Unlike other nerves which readily fire in
response to normal touch or temperature,

nociceptors will only fire once a certain
pain threshold has been passed.  Some of

these nociceptors respond quickly sending
signals to the spinal cord and brain
which produce sharp and sudden pain, allowing you to react quickly

while others transmit more slowly and are
responsible for the prolonged dull

ache you feel.  For males, testicles are
internal organs that have migrated out

of the body cavity which we explain in
a previous video you can check out here.

And well some internal organs such as
the liver feel no pain, others like the

testicles are covered with many 
nociceptors making them extremely sensitive.
Afterall their well-being is of the utmost importance.

Furthermore the testicles are attached
to many nerves in the stomach as well as

the vagus is nerve which is directly
connected to the brains vomit center,

and this is why when hit the pain spreads
throughout the abdomen.

The fact that testicles have minimal
protection only strengthens the

accompanying symptoms of nausea, increased
blood pressure, heart rate and sweating.

But not so fast gentlemen, even though
childbirth may not be facing a direct

blow to any internal organs, the
mechanical distension of the uterine

area also triggers nociceptors and
causes the same kind of visceral pain.

Also consider that throughout evolution
female human hips have become smaller

while babies heads have become
larger.  And not to mention labor lasts

8 hours on average with a mixture of
nausea, fatigue and pain.

On top of it all, tension and stretching
of muscle and tissue increase as labour

intensifies creating sharp and localized
pain.

Okay, so both obviously hurt and have a
lot of mechanical stimulation sending
signals to the pain centers of the brain.

But this is where it gets tricky, because
the pain isn't simply a physical

response but rather a partially
perceptive or subjective experience.

This means that every single individual
perceives pain in a slightly different

way.  And not only between individuals but
depending on your mood, alertness or even

previous experience pain may affect
you differently.

It's for this reason that so many
attempts to objectively measure pain have

failed including the dol system which
we mentioned earlier.

Interestingly nearly 80% of
upper limb amputees experience a
phenomenon known as "phantom limb pain".

That is they feel pain in a limb that is
no longer there.  And while little is

understood about the mechanism for the
pain, it is clear that there is no

particular input to trigger the response
and yet they still feel a very real
pain.

As such pain is not a stimulus it is an
experience that is different for

everybody.  Suffice to say both instances
of childbirth and getting hit in the
balls can hurt alot.

So we call this one at tie, apart from
the fact that the experiences are

completely different and there is so many
variables to consider.

In some instances a man could
experience more pain than his female

counterpart and vice versa.  The main
difference being one results in a newborn

baby, while the other potentially
results in a decreased the chance of
having one.

Got of burning question you want answered?
Ask it in the comments, or on facebook and twitter.
And subscribe to more weekly science videos.

title: Childbirth vs Getting Kicked in the Balls

Asking this question is like asking what a blind man's favorite color is, 
and what a deaf man's favorite sonata is. >.>

They're experiences the party can't experience. "You can't compare the two" 
is where the conversation should end. If it's a pain you don't experience, 
it's not pain to you. So it's very fucking easy to be biased towards your 
own pain right off the bat.﻿

comments.text:
Not really. Many of men have tried the childbirth simulators and almost all 
of them said it is worse than being kicked in the dick. This guys 
explanation has many flaws and a good argument can be made here. It is in 
fact true that childbirth is worse (I'm not saying this because I'm 
physically female. I'm saying this because I study a lot about childbirth 
and how the reproductive organs work, first of all, your vagina stretches 
to fit the baby through, so technically its not a quarter sized hole, but 
the fact is your fucking hole is stretching to a point that you might as 
well think its ripping in half, also another point I'd like to make is that 
not all women's hips are small and we don't all have the same body types, 
but it doesn't mean shit because it still hurts like a bitch, your fucking 
hips are moving apart so your baby can get through! That is known as 
contractions, contractions are known to be very VERY painful, as I said 
before, your fucking body is pushing itself to its limits! Just to push out 
a baby! What's worse is that babies come in different sizes and can get 
stuck! That's worse. But it doesn't stop there. Oh no. You experience a 
pressure unlike any you have ever faced! Many have explained it as a 
feeling of someone stepping on their vagina! Fucking ow! And remember the 
fact that it is rare for guys to die by being kicked in the testicals, but 
in child birth you can actually die or go into a coma! Women are designed 
to handle more pain than men, our periods hurt like a bitch, our backs hurt 
when you have big boobs, I don't understand when people say stupid things 
like this man! He is not a professional, it is easy to tell. He obviously 
didn't look into detail and is very ignorant of the human body. Now I'm not 
saying women are better or blah blah men are weak, dumb things like that. 
I'm just stating facts, men can go through very bad pains as well, if you 
look into the many dangers of their genitalia you can see that they too are 
prone to experience pain, all I am saying is, yea, women do have more pain. 
That doesn't make us better, it just means that we can handle it better. 
Men are not designed to experience these pains. Our pain is to simply make 
us more gutsy and strong mentally and a bit of physically depending on the 
woman. You cannot always believe what you read/watch online for people are 
not always educated and are most likely liars. Studying normal books and 
researching at a library or something can give you more insight.﻿

comments.text:

we are on the ground useless. Kind of sad.... That's why I learned how to 
accept pain. I don't scream I don't cry I don't curse I don't yell. Because 
I realized screaming will not make you feel better. So why does everyone 
scream when they are in pain. Screaming won't make it feel better so what's 
the point. When one realize they shouldn't scream while they are in pain. 
Dealing with pain becomes easier. That's how I learned﻿
comments.author: Byakuya Kuchiki

comments.text:
We all feel pain. We are human and it is inevitable. We may find it hard to 
understand ones pain for getting kicking in the balls or going through 
child birth because we dont have those parts, and we dont know what they 
feel like. The best thing we can all do is sympathize with one another. 
Both hurt us to the point of wanting to just die im sure. Does it really 
matter which is actually worse? The fact is they both hurt like fucking 
hell! To all the guys who have been kicked in the balls, that must suck and 
im sure it really hurts. I wish you wellness I hope someone buys you ice 
cream and I sympathize with you. When im going through child birth, write 
me a card saying what I just said to you. Boom, we are equal. :P﻿

comments.author: fernanumero3

comments.text:
+rasberryiceify What getting kicked in the balls feels like:
Stage 1: Intense Pain. Any painful action done to the balls is multiplied 
x30. A little flick? More like stabbed with a needle. A kick? Oh boy. It 
feels like an intense, burning, throbbing, stabbing pain.


Stage 2: Afterpain: Really, the pain is still there. It can last for 
minutes to hours. It basically feels like Satan fondling you. You often 
feel nausea, and no one would blame you if you vomited. If someone does, 
kick them in the nuts too.


Stage 3:???: A dull ache. You'll probably jizz blood.

comments.text:
+Lamar Pettway Imagine a watermelon and a half pushing out of a golf ball, 
not painful enough?..  Periods: bleeding every month in that week non stop 
bleeding..-cramps -painful headaches.-more cramps in the hips, making it 
hard to walk sometimes.-feeling like shit and wanting to murder people-more 
bleeding-craving chocolate, ice cream, and other sweets-wanting to sleep 
because you cant sleep at night.-nausea-still cant sleep because of the 
pain-sometime if you get lucky, you even get sick :\ hooray -more nausea - 
more pain-still hurting to walk-gaining weight, not helping with the 
craving of chocolate, -harder for us to loose weight-confused on what 
emotion to be.-want to eat even MORE-feeling like shit because you gained 
weight and feel really fat.-being lazy, makes you feel like more 
shit.-frustration -more bleeding-the fact we stare puberty and start our 
period at 10-12, then its REALLY painful, because you don't know whats 
going on.-going on a date and your still on your period.-medicine for the 
nausea and pain-more cramps.-More nausea-more pain..-more bleeding.....And 
that is just having your period.
Getting pregnant:..-nausea-pain-stretchmarks -no sleeping.-not comforitable 
in any position -wanting to eat ALOT, causing MORE nausea -craving, 
peanutbutter, spicy foods, sweet foods and all of the above.-wanting to 
kill someone -more emotional rolercoasters - cramping -even more pain-hips 
and back start to curve-having to have a body pillow to try and sleep more 
comfortably -sweating-tense -more frustration -wanting coffee -thinking of 
the future of your kid, and start crying.-still not sleeping-anger-lazy-not 
wanting to do anything or anyone -more stretch marks.....-more pain-more 
nausea -more emotional problems -more eating-labor -pushing a watermelon 
and1/2 threw a golf ball sized holestaying in a hospital for about 2 or 3 
days depending on how the child birth went.
Now lets talk about what men have to deal with...-Getting kicked in the 
balls incude....-nausea -damaged nerves (may, or may not 
happen.-headaches-pain-nerves hit the stomach area -only lasts for a few 
hours, not as bad.
other things incude:-boner -sitting wrong -running -walkingand so on.
so before you write a comment that "your just making up the thing girls 
have on their periods" or : men go threw more pain because they have to 
deal with every day, but there isn't as many side affects as girls 
have,girls have to go threw pain no matter what, because even if they grow 
out of the period stage, you sill get other side affects that are still 
painful...still a loose loose situation for the girls.. guys just don't 
realize what it feels like to have the period, giving birth, and so on, 
they just think, oh well just you just deal with it and its over with, its 
not that easy because, after you have the kid, you still are if pain for a 
few more months or the reason of is that you fractured a few bones while 
giving birth, and your stomach might or might not stay stretched out.men, 
go threw pain and have to go threw with having that between your legs your 
whole life, I get it, your saying that girls don't have as much pain as 
guys do, think about the stuff girls have to go threw, guys only have like: 
Boners, sitting weird, and so on.Now you can complain.
